page.title: 04THE MARKET IN EPPING
page.content: There has been a{Charter Market}in Epping since 1575, and from 1914 it has been on a Monday.The Town Council took control over the market from the District Council in 1981 because they thought that a smaller Council should administer it.The{Superintendent}of the Market collects the rent from the traders.There are{77}stalls whose rent is Â£8.00.If the traders don't turn up, they still have to pay.There is always a queue of casuals who eagerly wait for a vacant stall.There has always been a rent. The stalls are put up by outside contractors at 4:30a.m and are taken down by 9:00 p.m.The most{popular stalls are the clothes stalls,followed by the fruit 'n' veg, and then come household stalls. We shall always want to have a market in Epping.
